frontmatter.title: The disordered plant dehydrin Lti30 protects the membrane during water-related stress by cross-linking lipids
frontmatter.description: Dehydrins are intrinsically disordered proteins, generally expressed in plants as a response to embryogenesis and water-related stress. Their suggested functions are in membrane stabilization and cell protection. All dehydrins contain at least one copy of the highly conserved K-segment, proposed to be a membrane binding motif.
